author: Amrith Ramkumar
title: Gold Slides as Geopolitical Worries Fade
text:
Gold prices slid Thursday, erasing their Wednesday advance as worries about a clash between U.S. and Russian military forces in Syria faded.
Front-month gold for April delivery shed 1.3% to $1,338.40 a troy ounce on the Comex division of the New York Mercantile Exchange, halting a four-session winning streak. Prices have traded between about $1,305 and $1,360 this year, moving within that range based on safe-haven demand, swings in the dollar and worries about higher interest rates.
